qas.question: What is hunting and gathering argued to be?
What situation can cause food stresses that make hunting-gathering necessary?
What change from hunting and gathering to agriculture is not easy to mark?
Besides the use of agriculture, what other factor clouds the issue of the transition from hunting and gathering to agriculture?
How long has this cultural diffusion been happening?
The transition from hunting and gathering to agriculture is always a what process?
It is easy to draw a clear line between what?
The adaptive strategy has remained unchanged since what decade?

plausible_answers.text: when environmental change causes extreme food stress for agriculturalists

qas.question: When will hunting and gathering never be exploited?
The resulting cultural infusion has occurred in the last how many years?

context: The <a2_0>transition<a2_0/> from hunting and gathering to agriculture is not necessarily a <b5_0>one way<b5_0/> process. It has been argued that hunting and gathering represents an <a0_0>adaptive strategy<a0_0/>, which may still be exploited, if necessary, <b8_0>when <a1_0>environmental change<a1_0/> causes extreme food stress for agriculturalists<b8_0/>. In fact, it is sometimes difficult to draw a clear line between <b6_0>agricultural and hunter-gatherer societies<b6_0/>, especially since the widespread adoption of agriculture and resulting <a3_0>cultural diffusion<a3_0/> that has occurred in the <a4_0>last <b9_0>10,000<b9_0/> years<a4_0/>.[citation needed] This anthropological view has remained unchanged since the <b7_0>1960s<b7_0/>.[clarification needed][citation needed]
